posts.title: Move Over, NASCAR
posts.content:
Things are speeding up again in Springdale tonight with the third race of the Natural State Criterium Series.

  • High hopes: The Tyson-sponsored cycling series, which debuted in 2017, is aimed at becoming a stop on "the national cycling calendar by 2023." From beginners to pros, this racing series is creating a fast-paced, fun, and friendly opportunity for cyclists to try something new.
  • End in sight: The finish line is marked at Shiloh Square, with the first race set to begin at 5p. Tonight is third of a four-week series ending Aug. 18.

Learn more about the event and the "NASCAR of racing" HERE.

posts.title: Fast Pass to Florida
posts.content:
This winter, when you’re missing the heat and dreaming of sunshine again, the beach will be no-stops away from our local airport.

  • How: Starting Nov. 17, flights from XNA will directly connect to the Punta Gorda Airport (PGD) twice a week. Allegiant, a Las-Vegas based low-cost carrier, expanded its services to 25 new cities and included XNA as a part of its 22-route expansion.
  • Hot Deal: Special introductory one-way fares range from $39 to $59 if booked today (Aug. 11). 

Read more about the new XNA route HERE.

posts.title: Beers, Bikes, and Bella Vista
posts.content:
Summer evenings in Bella Vista just got a little more refreshing. If you've been looking for another place to bike for beers, look no further!

  • Relax in the park: The Gear Garden is now open in Blowing Springs Park, and features an adult beverage from Bentonville Brewing Company. From Wed-Sun, this is one "off the trail" experience you should consider.
  • All exclusive: A signature beer at the Gear Garden is the Trailhead Lager, which is offered at only a select locations throughout Bella Vista.

You can plan your visit to the Gear Garden HERE.

posts.title: A City Within a City
posts.content:
City U, a 375-unit multifamily project, is nearing completion in downtown Bentonville.

  • The schematics: The project will place 29 buildings on a 9-acre plot just north of the Momentary, creating a neighborhood-like feel in Bentonville's Market District. The development includes community rooms, podium parking, patios, and other amenities for a "unique living experience".
  • Intentional living: 30% of the available units will be offered as core housing to help individuals in a certain income bracket. The goal is to begin leasing to residents by early September.

Read how this development will impact the downtown area HERE.

posts.title: Do It for the Kids
posts.content:
Last week, two local fundraisers raised more than $1mm in support of Arkansas Children's Northwest Hospital.

  • Above and beyond: The Will Golf 4 Kids tournament and the Color of Hope Gala pledged to raise $5mm over five years in 2019. With $3.3mm raised in the first two years, they are well on their way to exceeding their goal.
  • Gone golfing: The overwhelming generosity of NWA has Arkansas Children's Northwest feeling like they've made a hole in one. The donations will go directly to "pediatric cancer research and support services."

You can read more about the events and donations HERE.
